verses.text_plain: Lo, mine eye hath seen all this, mine ear hath heard and understood it.
verses.verse_html: 1Lo, mine eye hath seen all this, mine ear hath heard and understood it.

verses.text_plain: What ye know, the same do I know also: I am not inferior unto you.
verses.verse_html: 2What ye know, the same do I know also: I am not inferior unto you.

verses.text_plain: Surely I would speak to the Almighty, and I desire to reason with God.
verses.verse_html: 3Surely I would speak to the Almighty, and I desire to reason with God.

verses.text_plain: But ye are forgers of lies, ye are all physicians of no value.
verses.verse_html: 4But ye are forgers of lies, ye are all physicians of no value.

verses.text_plain: O that ye would altogether hold your peace! and it should be your wisdom.
verses.verse_html: 5O that ye would altogether hold your peace! and it should be your wisdom.

tokens.text: and it should be your wisdom

verses.text_plain: Hear now my reasoning, and hearken to the pleadings of my lips.
verses.verse_html: 6Hear now my reasoning, and hearken to the pleadings of my lips.

verses.text_plain: Will ye speak wickedly for God? and talk deceitfully for him?
verses.verse_html: 7Will ye speak wickedly for God? and talk deceitfully for him?

verses.text_plain: Will ye accept his person? will ye contend for God?
verses.verse_html: 8Will ye accept his person? will ye contend for God?

verses.text_plain: Is it good that he should search you out? or as one man mocketh another, do ye so mock him?
verses.verse_html: 9Is it good that he should search you out? or as one man mocketh another, do ye so mock him?

tokens.text: that he should search you out

verses.text_plain: He will surely reprove you, if ye do secretly accept persons.
verses.verse_html: 10He will surely reprove you, if ye do secretly accept persons.

verses.text_plain: Shall not his excellency make you afraid? and his dread fall upon you?
verses.verse_html: 11Shall not his excellency make you afraid? and his dread fall upon you?

verses.text_plain: Your remembrances are like unto ashes, your bodies to bodies of clay.
verses.verse_html: 12Your remembrances are like unto ashes, your bodies to bodies of clay.

verses.text_plain: Hold your peace, let me alone, that I may speak, and let come on me what will.
verses.verse_html:
13Hold your peace, let me alone, that I may speak, and let come on me what will.
 Hold: Heb. Be silent from me

tokens.text: let me alone, that I may speak

footnotes.body_text: Hold: Heb. Be silent from me
footnotes.body_html: Hold: Heb. Be silent from me

verses.text_plain: Wherefore do I take my flesh in my teeth, and put my life in mine hand?
verses.verse_html: 14Wherefore do I take my flesh in my teeth, and put my life in mine hand?

verses.text_plain: Though he slay me, yet will I trust in him: but I will maintain mine own ways before him.
verses.verse_html:
15Though he slay me, yet will I trust in him: but I will maintain mine own ways before him.
 maintain: Heb. prove, or, argue

tokens.text: in him: but I will maintain

footnotes.body_html: maintain: Heb. prove, or, argue

verses.text_plain: He also shall be my salvation: for an hypocrite shall not come before him.
verses.verse_html: 16He also shall be my salvation: for an hypocrite shall not come before him.

verses.text_plain: Hear diligently my speech, and my declaration with your ears.
verses.verse_html: 17Hear diligently my speech, and my declaration with your ears.

verses.text_plain: Behold now, I have ordered my cause; I know that I shall be justified.
verses.verse_html: 18Behold now, I have ordered my cause; I know that I shall be justified.

verses.text_plain: Who is he that will plead with me? for now, if I hold my tongue, I shall give up the ghost.
verses.verse_html: 19Who is he that will plead with me? for now, if I hold my tongue, I shall give up the ghost.

tokens.text: with me? for now, if I hold my tongue
I shall give up the ghost

verses.text_plain: Only do not two things unto me: then will I not hide myself from thee.
verses.verse_html: 20Only do not two things unto me: then will I not hide myself from thee.

tokens.text: unto me: then will I not hide

verses.text_plain: Withdraw thine hand far from me: and let not thy dread make me afraid.
verses.verse_html: 21Withdraw thine hand far from me: and let not thy dread make me afraid.

tokens.text: from me: and let not thy dread

verses.text_plain: Then call thou, and I will answer: or let me speak, and answer thou me.
verses.verse_html: 22Then call thou, and I will answer: or let me speak, and answer thou me.

verses.text_plain: How many are mine iniquities and sins? make me to know my transgression and my sin.
verses.verse_html: 23How many are mine iniquities and sins? make me to know my transgression and my sin.

verses.text_plain: Wherefore hidest thou thy face, and holdest me for thine enemy?
verses.verse_html: 24Wherefore hidest thou thy face, and holdest me for thine enemy?

verses.text_plain: Wilt thou break a leaf driven to and fro? and wilt thou pursue the dry stubble?
verses.verse_html: 25Wilt thou break a leaf driven to and fro? and wilt thou pursue the dry stubble?

verses.text_plain: For thou writest bitter things against me, and makest me to possess the iniquities of my youth.
verses.verse_html: 26For thou writest bitter things against me, and makest me to possess the iniquities of my youth.

tokens.text: against me, and makest me to possess

verses.text_plain: Thou puttest my feet also in the stocks, and lookest narrowly unto all my paths; thou settest a print upon the heels of my feet.
verses.verse_html:
27Thou puttest my feet also in the stocks, and lookest narrowly unto all my paths; thou settest a print upon the heels of my feet.
 lookest: Heb. observest
 ,
 heels: Heb. roots

verses.text_plain: And he, as a rotten thing, consumeth, as a garment that is moth eaten.
verses.verse_html: 28And he, as a rotten thing, consumeth, as a garment that is moth eaten.

tokens.text: And he, as a rotten thing
